title.rendered: “IDF Airstrikes Target Hezbollah Structures After Anti-Tank Missile Launches from Lebanon”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

Documentation: The IDF attacked the military structure from which anti-tank missiles were launched towards the Shetula area this morning.

Earlier today, two anti-tank missile launches were identified coming from the Ayta a-Shab area towards Shetula, with no casualties reported. Following the identification of the launch source, Air Force fighter jets struck the Hezbollah military structure in the Ayta a-Shab area from which the launch was conducted into Israeli territory.

Additionally, Air Force fighter jets targeted a military structure in the Maroun area and a terror infrastructure in the Nakura area.

In response to warnings activated in northern Israel at 1:02 PM, about 20 launches were identified crossing from Lebanon towards the Miron area. As a result of the launches, several fires broke out in the area, with no casualties reported. Fire and rescue teams are on-site working to extinguish the fires.

Attached is documentation from the attacks: https://bit.ly/4btgrN2
